subject: How to create a dynamic form for Junit test.
msgSnippet: Hi,All, I have to create EditUser object for writing junit test for a method of it. The constructor of class EditUser : public EditUser(Token token,
messageBody:
Hi,All,

I have to create EditUser object for writing junit test for a
method of it. The constructor of class EditUser :

public EditUser(Token token, MessageResources messages, URLBaseDynaForm
form)
throws Exception {
super(token, messages, form);
setDisplay(false);
}

And from class hierarchy of URLBaseDynaForm,

class hierarchy of URLBaseDynaForm
-------------------------------------------
java.lang.Object
|
+-org.apache.struts.action.ActionForm

|
+-org.apache.struts.action.DynaActionForm

|
+-org.apache.struts.validator.DynaValidatorForm

|
+-org.apache.struts.validator.DynaValidatorActionForm

|
+-com.webex.webapp.urlapi.common.URLBaseDynaForm
-------------------------------------------
we know that it is a dynamic form; I can not new this dynamic form
directly as below,

URLBaseDynaForm urlBaseDynaForm = new URLBaseDynaForm();

After googing, I got a solution:

DynaBean form = new WrapDynaBean(EditUserVO); // EditUserVO is a POJO

DynaBean is a interface that is implemented by DynaActionForm class.

It seems OK. But I have to modified the constructor of EditUser to
satisfy this operation -it is unacceptable for me to change source code
for writing Junit test cases.

public EditUser(Token token, MessageResources messages, DynaBean form)
throws Exception {
super(token, messages, form);
setDisplay(false);
}

any other ideas for replacing this solution? and then how to create
a my URLBaseDynaForm object? Your help will be highly appreciated.

Regards,

-Hut






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
